```{.r .cell-code}
meta_2024 <- read.csv(file = "nip_bg_24/nip_metadata_24.csv")
shp_2024 <- sf::read_sf(dsn = "nip_bg_24/nip_bg_24.shp")
BR_boundary <- sf::read_sf(dsn = "Badger_Rock_Boundary.kml")

lakes <-  sf::read_sf(dsn = "LakesPonds/LakesPonds.shp") %>% dplyr::filter(HYDTYPE == "Lake") %>% dplyr::filter(NAME %in% c("Lake Mendota", "Lake Monona", "Lake Wingra")) %>% head(-1)

# geo_id for Badger Rock is 550250015022, 550250015023, Madison is Mdsn2024
N1 <- shp_2024 %>% dplyr::filter(geo == "550250015022")

N2 <- shp_2024 %>% dplyr::filter(geo == "550250015023")
N2$NAME <- "Badger Rock"

MDSN <- shp_2024 %>% dplyr::filter(geo == "Mdsn2024")

# Everything except the whole city and our neighborhood
all_other_neighborhoods <- shp_2024 %>% dplyr::filter(!geo %in% c("550250015022", "550250015023","Mdsn2024"))

ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = all_other_neighborhoods, aes(fill = tot_pop), show.legend = TRUE) + 
  geom_sf(data = N1, color = "purple", aes(fill = tot_pop), linewidth = 1) +
  geom_sf(data = N2, color = "blue", aes(fill = tot_pop), linewidth = 1) +
  geom_sf_text(data = N2, aes(label = NAME), size = 2.5,  nudge_y = -0.012) +
  geom_sf(data = lakes, color = "blue") +
  geom_sf_text(data = lakes, aes(label = NAME), size = 2.0) +
  scale_fill_distiller(palette = "BuPu", direction = 1) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_blank(),
        axis.text.y = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        rect = element_blank(),
        axis.title.y=element_blank(),
        axis.title.x=element_blank())
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

give correct results for longitude/latitude data

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot() +
  geom_sf(data = N1, color = "purple", aes(fill = NULL), linewidth = 1, alpha = 0) +
  geom_sf(data = N2, color = "blue", aes(fill = NULL), linewidth = 1, alpha = 0) +
  geom_sf(data = BR_boundary, color = "black", aes(fill = NULL), linewidth = 1, alpha = 0) +

  scale_fill_distiller(palette = "BuPu", direction = 1) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_blank(),
        axis.text.y = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        rect = element_blank(),
        axis.title.y=element_blank(),
        axis.title.x=element_blank())
```
